application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown thin by 30% and height reduction by 6m to One Oak T44 on TPO 168
decision_conditions: The Oak is situated within the front garden of 215 Long Lane. Long Lane is a main trunk route through the borough and as a result this Oak has a Very High amenity value with the potential for a long life.

There is some contradiction between the applied for work and the reasons behind the work, one of the reasons for the work is "to reduce spread" however a height reduction and thin will not achieve this and no lateral reduction has been applied for. No arboricultural evidence has been provided to show that this Oak is a hazard, as a result a height reduction by a much as 6m has not been justified and would leave the Oak with an unnatural topped appearance. A crown thin by as much as 30% would likely lead to lion-tailing and will leave multiple wounds throughout the Oaks canopy, which would likely cause stress and lead to infection, affecting its long-term health; this would affect the safe useful life expectancy of this Oak.
Having regard to the reasons given for the proposed work,
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
